txt.en: Instance: A Final Reckoning
'We fought to avenge Thrór, yes?'
'He is avenged, and ravens pick clean the head of Azog.'
'Indeed, the cup of victory is ours.'
'The debt is paid.'
'But it is too heavy for our hands to grip, and its draught is bitter!'
'It is ended!'
'All have heard the songs of Khazad-dûm's fall.'
'Thrór is avenged, and Azog is slain!'
'Even with the full strength of all the Houses, taking it would cost more than we would care to spend.'
'I thank you for helping me up those stairs, Hermáth.'
'Haunt this place no longer, lest you share his fate!'
'Alone? It would be easier to pluck the stars from Kheled-zâram.'
'But not even this accursed leg-wound will keep me from my duty...'
'No, Dáin speaks aright.'
'I would see to this myself, Ironfoot.'
'If we mean to take back our home, then let that home be the Lonely Mountain.'
'My father, Agni, would not have had it any other way!'
'Bah! It did not seem so far when I walked down here!'
'Father Thrór... you are avenged.'
'I mourn the loss of my father, Usk. A curse upon the Orcs!'
'Go on, Hermáth. Tell my son I will be along soon enough!'
'Dwarves! Kin! Cousins! Here, before the eyes of Durin, we honour our dead!'
'Let us send the lords and Kings of the Seven Houses to the forge of the First Crafter!'
'May their valour and their sacrifices never be forgotten!'
'Father Vélat fell in the fighting, but he is a hero among the Zhélruka!'
'By your torch, Hermáth...'
'I am the last of my line, and our dead are beyond counting.'
'How would you pay their weregilds, Longbeard?'
'Dragons stole your wealth long ago.'
'Would you have us pluck it from their hoards?'
'Let us be done with this! It is time we returned to our own lands.'
'The war is over, heir of Durin.'
'You may lack one eye, but you still have a second with which to see as much!'
'Even without the others, I had hoped that Khazad-dûm might still be won.'
'But even I cannot ignore such dire portents...'
'The stars have gone, Hermáth.'
'Durin's Crown has fallen into darkness...'
'King Thráin, someone approaches...'
'Khazad-dûm is lost.'
'I have been long enough in my thoughts, friend. Let us return...'
'I am sorry for my delay, my son.'
'I had need to look to Kheled-zâram, and the stars gave their answer.'
'Of Bolg and the other surviving Orcs, I found no sign.'
'So I crept down the stairs of the First Hall...'
'Too many of our flames have been extinguished, but I thank you.'
'But then a sound echoed out of the darkness...'
'Something horrid, beyond Orc or troll... as if flame itself was given voice.'
'And a distant glimmer grew out of the gloom as it came forth!'
'Khazad-dûm was the house of your Fathers, not ours.'
'What should we care to face what lies within?'
'Whatever riches it once held were lost long ago!'
'We are faithful to you, King Thráin.'
'But know this: Khazad-dûm, though near, lies beyond our grasp.'
'For I have seen what lies within its shadows...'
'Durin's Bane!'
'And it is beyond your skill, or the skill of any here, to vanquish such a foe.'
'It would be better to face Smaug himself than such a terror!'
'A day shall come when our people walk Khazad-dûm once more, but it is not this day.'
'As the cold winter's night wore on, the Dwarves of the Haban’akkâ huddled in the dale.'
'It will take a power great indeed, and a world changed, before we tread again within its halls.'
'But there would be no songs, nor any great speeches or feasts.'
'We will not enter Khazad-dûm, and neither will you, King Thráin.'
'Those who had survived dreamt dark dreams as they slept among the dead.'
'Azanulbizar was hard won, but it is ours at last.'
'Although they did not yet know it, many of the wounded would not wake again.'
'And now, no enemy stands between our people and Khazad-dûm!'
'At dawn, the Kings of the Seven Houses gathered again at Durin's Stone.'
'Well, then?'
'What of you, my kin? Do you also mean to abandon me?'
'What say you, Oakenshield?'
'Be not silent. I would hear your word in this as well.'
'And why is that, Ironfoot?'
'And so it was decided that the dwarves would depart Azanulbizar.'
'Nár! Why have you come, my friend?'
'But before they did so, they took the arms and mail from their dead.'
'Too many were slain to entomb, and against their custom, they turned instead to fire.'
'The dwarves felled every tree in the dale until Azanulbizar lay barren.'
'There they built great pyres upon which to burn their dead.'
'Enough blood has been shed at Azanulbizar...'
'It will take many years to recover what was lost. But you have my thanks, Longbeard.'
'I thank you. We have lost many, but it was not in vain.'
'And so honoured were the Marasrân, the Burned Dwarves of Azanulbizar.'
'Thrór has taken his place at the forge of the First Crafter.'
'Let us honour our dead and begone from this place!'
